availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Elza Thomason (Scott County, Kentucky, farmer and hotel keeper)

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, farmer and hotel keeper. Kentucky native. Son of Delilah Thomason. Father of John D. Thomason. Married to Eliza J. Bratton Thomason. Father of Adelia Thomason, William Thomason, Elder J. Thomason, Cora Thomason, Claud L. Thomason, and Helen Thomason. Farmer in Scott County in 1850. Household owned two enslaved persons in Scott County in 1850. Hotel keeper in Scott County in 1860. Employed James Welsh as a barkeeper in Scott County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Scott County in 1860. Farmer in Scott County in 1863.
